# 8.1 Organizations

Organizations provide structure, support, and obligations. Your [[References/Rank System|Rank]] within an organization determines what benefits you receive and what duties you owe.

## Organization Benefits

Organizations provide downtime benefits based on your rank. Each organization has different strengths.

### Benefit Categories

| Category | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| **Lodging** | Quality of accommodations provided |
| **Medical** | Quality of healing and recovery facilities |
| **Training** | Quality of instruction and materials available |
| **Income** | Quality of guaranteed work opportunities |
| **Special** | Unique access (libraries, armories, contacts, etc.) |

### Reading Organization Benefits

Benefits are expressed as formulas based on your Rank:
- `= Rank` means benefit quality equals your rank
- `= Rank + 1` means one quality level above your rank
- `(max 3)` means capped at that quality level
- `(min 2)` means floor at that quality level

---

## Example Organizations

### Church / Religious Order

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | = Rank | Temple quarters, monastery cells |
| Medical | = Rank + 1 | Healing magic and trained healers |
| Training | = Rank (min 2) | Theological instruction always adequate+ |
| Income | = Rank (max 3) | Charitable work, ceremonies, scribing |
| Special | Sacred texts, sanctuary rights, congregation support |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Attend services, follow doctrine, tithe (10% income) |
| 2 | Lead minor ceremonies, provide spiritual counsel to commoners |
| 3 | Manage temple affairs, train initiates, answer summons |
| 4 | Oversee multiple temples, represent church politically |
| 5 | Set doctrine, major religious decisions, lead in crises |

### Thieves Guild / Criminal Network

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | = Rank - 1 (min 1) | Safe houses, hidden rooms |
| Medical | = Rank (max 3) | Back-alley surgeons, no questions asked |
| Training | = Rank | Criminal skills, combat, stealth |
| Income | = Rank | Fencing goods, contracts, protection |
| Special | Black market access, forged documents, information network |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Pay tribute (15-20%), respect territory, keep secrets |
| 2 | Take assigned jobs, mentor newcomers, enforce guild rules |
| 3 | Run operations, handle disputes, recruit new members |
| 4 | Manage territory, negotiate with other factions, plan major heists |
| 5 | Set guild policy, manage alliances/wars, protect the network |

### Mercenary Company

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | = Rank | Barracks to officer quarters |
| Medical | = Rank | Company surgeons and healers |
| Training | = Rank + 1 | Combat-focused, excellent facilities |
| Income | = Rank | Contracts, garrison duty |
| Special | Equipment access, military contacts, letters of marque |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Follow orders, maintain gear, share spoils (company cut) |
| 2 | Lead small teams, train recruits, take point on missions |
| 3 | Plan operations, manage squads, handle logistics |
| 4 | Negotiate contracts, coordinate multiple units, represent company |
| 5 | Set company strategy, major contract decisions, maintain reputation |

### Wizard Academy / Magical Institution

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | = Rank | Student dorms to master suites |
| Medical | = Rank | Magical healing available |
| Training | = Rank + 1 (max 4) | Excellent magical instruction |
| Income | = Rank - 1 (min 1) | Research stipends, enchanting work |
| Special | Library access (= Rank), laboratory facilities, rare components |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Attend lectures, follow academy rules, assist senior students |
| 2 | Conduct assigned research, tutor junior students |
| 3 | Teach courses, publish findings, serve on committees |
| 4 | Lead research projects, mentor faculty, represent academy |
| 5 | Set academic policy, major institutional decisions, external relations |

### Noble House

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | = Rank + 1 | Estate living, appropriate to station |
| Medical | = Rank | Personal physicians |
| Training | = Rank (max 3) | Tutors for social/martial skills |
| Income | = Rank | Estate income, investments |
| Special | Political connections, legal representation, household staff |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Maintain appearance, attend social functions, uphold family name |
| 2 | Manage minor holdings, represent house at local events |
| 3 | Govern territories, provide justice, maintain infrastructure |
| 4 | Regional politics, feudal military obligations, major alliances |
| 5 | Kingdom-level politics, war decisions, dynastic responsibilities |

## Creating Organizations

Use this template for custom organizations:

```
### Organization Name

| Benefit | Formula | Notes |
|---------|---------|-------|
| Lodging | | |
| Medical | | |
| Training | | |
| Income | | |
| Special | |

| Rank | Obligations |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | |
| 2 | |
| 3 | |
| 4 | |
| 5 | |
```

Consider:
- What is the organization's primary purpose?
- What resources does it have access to?
- What does it demand from members?
- What is its maximum rank (organizational scope)?
